Subtlety has received an array of changes in Legion, altering both their core identity and their strengths and weaknesses. Subtlety Rogues continue to provide strong single-target pressure, but it now brings respectable AoE to the table as well. Much of the rotation involves actively shifting between two stances, in and out of Stealth. Some abilities can be used at anytime, however, certain abilities can only be used while you are in Stealth Icon Stealth. There are only a limited number of ways to activate Stealth Icon Stealth during combat, and therefore the core component of this specialization revolves around managing your abilities to correctly time windows of burst.
Weaponmaster: grants your abilities a 6% chance to strike twice per target hit.
Master of Subtlety: Attacks made while stealthed and for 5 seconds after breaking stealth cause an additional 10% damage.
Gloomblade: replaces your Backtab, deals shadow damage and is unaffected by facing.
Nightstalker: increase movement speed by 20%% and damage by 12%% while Stealth and Shadow Dance are active.
Subterfuge allows: abilities requiring Stealth to be used for an additional 3 seconds after Stealth breaks.
Shadow Focus: reduces the Energy cost of abilities by 25% when used from stealth or while Shadow Dance is active.
Soothing Darkness: allows you to regenerate 3 percent of your maximum life per second while Stealth is active.
Elusiveness: causes Feint to also grant 30 percent reduced damage taken from all sources.

Cheat Death: causes fatal damage to instead reduce you to 7 percent of your maximum health and grant 85% reduced damage taken for 3 seconds. Cheat Death cannot save you from damage great that double your maximum health. It has a 6-minute cooldown.
Strike from the Shadows: causes your Shadowstrike to also stun the target for 2 seconds (5-second daze against players).
Prey on the Weak: causes enemies disabled from your Kidney Shot, Sap, and Cheap Shot to take 10% increased damage from all sources.
Tangled Shadow: causes Nightblade to decrease the targets movement speed by an additional 20%.
Dark Shadows: causes you to deal an additional 30% damage while Shadow Dance is active.
Alacrity causes finishing moves to have a 20% chance per Combo Point to grant 2% haste for 20 seconds, stacking 10 times.
Enveloping Shadows: grants an additional charge to Shadow Dance and causes Deepening Shadows to reduce the cooldown of dance by an additional 1.0 second per Combo Point consumed.
Master of Shadows: causes you to immediately gain 25 Energy when entering Stealth or Shadow Dance.
Mark of Death: marks a target and instantly generates 5 Combo Points. The cooldown is reset if the marked target dies.
Death from Above: is a two-part finishing move with a short cooldown that ends with an automatic cast of a 50% stronger Eviscerate.
